Returns: a string representation of the object.
toString().Description: Returns a string representation of the object. This version returns the concatenation of class name, "(", a name identifying the attribute and ")".

Returns: true if this object is the same as the obj argument; false otherwise.
Parameters: Object: the reference object with which to compare.
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares two objects for equality. This version only returns true for x.equals(y) if x and y refer to the same object, and guarantees this for all subclasses.

AttributedCharacterIterator.Attribute(ja.Description: Constructs an Attribute with the given name.

Throws: if the object to resolve is not an instance of Attribute
readResolve().Description: Resolves instances being deserialized to the predefined constants.

getName().Description: Returns the name of the attribute.

Returns: a hash code value for this object.
hashCode().Description: Returns a hash code value for the object. This version is identical to the one in Object, but is also final.

ClassDesc: Defines attribute keys that are used to identify text attributes. These keys are used in AttributedCharacterIterator and AttributedString.
